data.title: This Week in Nintendo Downloads - News
data.text:
Seven new games have been added this week to Nintendo's downloadable game services, three for WiiWare, one for Virtual Console and three for DSiWare. To kick off the week, gaijin games released lilt line, a musical racing game where players guide a line through a series of notes in order to create a full tune. The full game has been priced at 500 Wii Points ($5), while the demo version is available for download free of charge.

The second WiiWare game this week is Family Games from Icon Games Entertainment. Family Games contains a series of classic pen and paper games such as Connect Four, tic-tac-toe, and hangman. The title can be downloaded for 500 Wii Points ($5).

Closing the WiiWare update this week from Keystone Game Studio is Violin Paradise, a rhythm game where players play the parts of a conductor and a small string section which includes the viola, the violin, and the cello. Players can choose from 50 classic songs. Violin Paradise has been priced at 700 Wii Points ($7).

The lone Virtual Console update this week is Darius Twin from Taito, originally for the Super NES. The title is a classic shoot 'em up where players take control of ships commanded by the Galactic Federation. The title can be purchased for 800 Wii Points ($8).

DSiWare sees an interesting re-release in Little Red Riding Hood's Zombie BBQ from Gamick Entertainment. As the title implies, players will be able to play the role of the classic fairy tale character as she mows down the hordes of the undead. Originally available as a retail package, the shooting game has been priced at 800 DSi Points ($8).

Jam Space: Pocket Studio from HB Studios is the second game this week for DSiware. The title is a music composition app where players can compose songs incorporating a variety of musical samples and instruments. The app has been priced at 500 DSi Points ($5).
